parameters: Just head to the right and keep moving forward! The cure
I'm not supposed to be going this way.
How long have we been walking...?
It hasn't even been that long. Just be patient.
But it's been so long since we aaaate...
Stay back! Don't come any closer, vile bandits.
We're not bandits. Just a wandering mercenary
I see. If you are such a wandering mercenary, might you
be able to lend me a hand?
My friend here has been stricken by a deadly illness, no
doubt the result of one of the poisonous plants in the area.
\FS[20] I'm sure he can just get better...
We are novice traders you see. We were told that there was
a shortcut to the village but it ended up leading right
into a thicket of the dreaded stuff.
Be careful of who you trust around here. Seems
like everyone's out to get each other these
If only I'd listened to your advice sooner!
But I'm getting ahead of myself! There, into the deeper
forest lies a cure! I'd go myself, but it's awfully
dangerous and I can't leave my friend and our export here
*Sniff* What is it you export exactly?
We're merchants! There's a little marketplace in the town
we come from, Old Gravelton. We sell fruits but we're always
MERC! WE HAVE TO HELP THESE PEOPLE! THEY ARE IN
Just head to the right and keep moving forward! The cure
Consider your goods- I mean, your partner's
You guys! What's the holdup?! Get over here!
I'm right here! I'm glad you're alive.
Agh, I can tell it's been a while.
Never taking that path again, right?
These travelers are the ones who were able to get the
Please sir, it was OUR pleasure-
Yeah it's all good! So, where're all those
Yo, Ben, did you tell this chick that?
Well, they did save your life. According to the big dude.
To be honest, I don't know about the girl.
She does look distinctly less heroic.
Maybe it's best for our reputation if we hold up our end
I-isn't that a bit much for the both of you?
I say let her take what she needs to! We'll just be smarter
about where we travel, next time.
(Listen, we're still trying to make money here. There won't
BE a next time if these two yank all our goods!)
(I'm beginning to suspect that this was all a setup-)
Ah, well I think we've had enough, actually!
Hah, you guys were so nice to us and we are
Listen, you can't keep doing that. I'm supposed
to be a HERO, not a freeloader.
Well, they were offering, so all I did was take
And they had so much stuff...
More than half of which now resides within your
arms. How do you plan on carrying all this junk
Immediately, Autumn lays down an armful of the fruits and
vegetables she's collected from the merchants, just as
Merc finishes putting the pieces together.
You can't be serious. There's enough here to
feed at least like, three people.
Finishing her smug statement, Autumn then turns to look at
the bounty in front of her.
Apples, grapes, bananas, and any other common fruit you
could possibly imagine sat comfortably in front of her,
moments away from being shoved into her drooling jaw.
The presumably humble village girl began to tear into the
bowl, tackling each item with an unmannered abandon.
Though she at least had the thought to eat one item at a
time, the speed at which she devoured gave the impression
that the poor girl had been starving.
D-didn't you have those pies a while ago? I get
that you don't have the belly anymore, but I'd
have thought you'd be full at least till the
Autumn, focused on the objective at hand, didn't look up
to respond to Merc, only affirming his statment with an
Just as the amount of fruit began to finally seem to dimish,
so too did the stomach of the girl proportionally begin to
fill outwards, pushing against the fabric of her dress.
The bowl in front of Autumn had nearly been conquered, with
only smaller items like grapes or berries gathered at the
Without a second thought, Autumn grabs the bowl and dumps
the remainder in her mouth, putting an end to the young
Though the bowl now remained empty, it was incredibly
evident as to where its contents now resided.
Y'know. I adventure a lot. So I see weird
I'm not going to say that this is probably even
in the top ten, but y'know, this'll probably
stick around. Maybe it's top 20 material.
Oh pssh, I've just got a SLIGHTLY big appetite
is all! People see it once, but they get used
Yes. Quite impressive. Listen, we're still
going to the town. Can you walk fine or is THIS
Merc jabs at the girl's stomach with her finger. It now
portruded quite a bit from its original position, giving
the impression that she swallowed a watermelon.
Each step causes her large belly to sway left and right as
she makes an attempt to balance herself.
It clearly didn't like all of the movement, and voiced its
The remains of a fruit-flavored massacre.
North: (Something is written here, but it's all smudged up.)
I'm not supposed to be going this way.
